intro: Melandrium keiskei f. leucanthum, commonly known as the white-flowered catchfly, is a botanical variant of the species Melandrium keiskei. It is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and clustered flowers. The most notable botanical feature of this form is its pale to white flowers, which contrast with the typical pink or red hues of the species. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas, thriving in temperate climates. The plant's structure and flowering pattern make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural cultivation.
